words.enSent: Jack's small start-up evolved into a successful tech company.
words.zhSent: 傑克的小型新創公司逐漸發展成一家成功的科技公司。

words.enSent: In most countries' education systems, students specialize more as they get older.
words.zhSent: 在多數國家的教育體系中，學生隨著年齡增長會更趨於專攻。

words.enSent: The fast-food restaurant targeted young children by offering a free toy.
words.zhSent: 那家速食餐廳透過提供免費玩具，把年幼兒童作為目標。

words.enSent: Matt is looking to buy a phone in the two- to three-thousand-dollar price range.
words.zhSent: 馬特打算購買一支落在兩到三千美元價位範圍的手機。

words.enSent: The company invested more money into social media in an attempt to increase brand awareness.
words.zhSent: 該公司投入更多社群媒體的資金，試圖提高品牌知名度。

words.enSent: Selling online has become very popular, but companies still need to pay close attention to traditional sales channels, too.
words.zhSent: 線上銷售變得很受歡迎，但企業仍須密切注意傳統的銷售管道。

words.enSent: Our marketing department will create promotional material to advertise the new product.
words.zhSent: 我們的行銷部門會製作宣傳素材來為這項新產品做廣告。

words.enSent: The government ran a campaign to clean up the city.
words.zhSent: 政府發起了一項清理城市的活動。

words.enSent: The director thanked the movie's many collaborators in his acceptance speech for the award.
words.zhSent: 導演在上台領獎致詞時感謝了這部電影的眾多合作者。

words.enSent: All of the workers needed to be supervised closely to make sure things were done safely in the factory.
words.zhSent: 所有工人都需要被緊密監督，以確保工廠內的作業安全。

words.enSent: The scientists conducted experiments to try and find a cure.
words.zhSent: 科學家們進行了實驗，試圖尋找治療方法。

words.enSent: The product's competitive pricing made it popular with consumers on limited budgets.
words.zhSent: 這款產品具有競爭力的定價，使它在預算有限的消費者之間大受歡迎。
